results.title: Volcano
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles and Alan Probert
results.brief_description: Describes the growth of the volcano Paricutin, which rose suddenly in central Mexico. Sequences cover the volcano’s first eruption in 1943, and its sturdy growth since that time. Shows water vapor, rocks, molten lava, the throat of the cone, and some of the devastation wrought in nearby areas by the slow crushing advance of the lava flow.

results.title: Volcanism: eruption of Kilauea, Hawaii
results.creator_credit: International Cinemedia Center and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Dramatic film clippings show eruptions of Kilauea in the Hawaiian Islands during 1955 and 1959-60. No narration - natural sound only.

results.title: Volcanism
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Volcanoes are often found where the continental plates converge or diverge, or in designated “hot spots” in the middle of plates such as can be found in the Hawaiian region. A handful of special volcanoes formed along rift zones, can also be found. The study of volcanoes and their activities, casts new light on the internal structure of the earth and their impact on other phenomena such as the weather.

results.title: Volcanic fury - White Island
results.brief_description: A party of New Zealand scientists visit White Island off the coast of the North Island to study its thermal activity, structure and mineral deposits. This film illustrates their work and environment: the disused sulphur mill which was the site of their base camp; measurement of temperature in boiling pools to record shifting thermal activity; determination of the acidity of liquid in these pools; examination of the volcanic crust including the mosaics of caked mud and ash; study of the island’s birdlife.

results.title: Volatile substances
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”
Informational film on the hazards associated with the abuse of common domestic and industrial chemicals: solvents, aerosol propellants, and anaesthetics. Alludes briefly to the injury which can result from the toxicity of these chemicals - permanent impairment of motor function and acute organ pathology. Directed more towards adult caregivers than the children and adolescents who are more likely to abuse these substances.

results.title: Voici le Temps des Assassins = a Time for Murder
results.creator_credit: Robert Bossis, Charles Borderie and Julien Duvivier
results.brief_description:
Andre Chatelain is a quiet, middle-aged restaurant owner in Les Halles district of Paris. His life becomes unexpectedly complicated when Catherine pays a visit. She introduces herself as the daughther of his late ex-wife. Moved by the distress of Catherine, Andre invites her to stay with him. Soon after, Gerard, Andre’s adopted son, is smitten by the young woman. But she makes it clear she is only interested in Andre. Andre, however, suspects the young woman to be a liar and possibly a psychotic, mixed up with a number of underworld types. This film offers a very realistic depiction of the life and activities of Les Halles at the time it was considered as the ‘belly of Paris’. The title song is interpreted by Germaine Montero.

Credits: Producers, Charles Borderie, Robert Bossis ; director, Julien Duvivier ; writers, Julien Duvivier, Maurice Bessy, Charles Dorat ; photography, Armand Thirard ; music, Jean Wiener.
Cast: Jean Gabin, Daniele Delorme, Grerad Blain, Germaine Kerjean, Lucienne Bogaert, Robert Arnoux, Jean-Paul Roussillon, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Voices on the Page: David Williamson (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Film Australia and Ian Walker
results.brief_description: The “Compulsive Playwright” provides you with a unique insight into the man and his work. His early experience, the problems of writing for film (Gallipoli), lecturing to students on the writing process, and rehearsing with actors, are all part of this entertaining and informative video. This package has been designed for students of literature everywhere. It has a particular application for students studying senior English at Years 11 and 12 and tertiary institutions. Study guide included.

results.title: Voices of Malaya
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, Colonial Office, Ralth Eaton and Terry Trench
results.brief_description: Voices of Malaya was made before hostilities in Malaya began, in the period immediately after World War 2. It is primarily a background study of the problems facing a country with a population of five million people - Malayan, Chinese-Malayan, Indian-Malayan and European - who are suffering from the aftermath of war. It shows the efforts of the mixed nationalities of Malaya working and living together in the best interests of their country. Music by Elizabeth Lutyens, played by The Philharmonic Orchestra and conducted by John Hollingsworth.
